name: TRINTEL I
notes:
Originally intended for steel construction but adapted for fiberglass. Hulls molded by Tyler and finished by Anne Wever. Deck and coachroof were wood. Earlier boats had wood masts; Later delivered with aluminum spars. 
The TRINTEL IA (also called THE HARMONY 29) is slightly longer, the transom hung, rudder has been done away with, and the coachroof and deck are fiberglass. (FG components were molded by Tyler Boat Co.(UK).)
Thanks to Jan Dirks for corrections.
